DSA TOPICS TO STUDY

1.FOUNDATIONS
Time and space complexity ^/
Big O notation ^/
Recursion ^/
Iteration vs recursion ^/
Hash tables and hashing basics 

2.ARRAYS
Array traversal
Searching
Prefix sum
Sliding window
Two pointers
Kadane algorithm
Sorting basics

3.STRINGS
Character arrays vs strings
Two pointer techniques
Substrings and subsequences
String hashing basics
Anagram problems
Palindrome problems

4.HASHMAP AND HASHSET
Frequency map
Checking existence
Counting pairs
Using map with custom keys
unordered_map usage

5.LINKED LIST
Singly linked list
Fast and slow pointers
Cycle detection
Middle element
Reverse a linked list
Merge two sorted lists
Intersection of lists

6.STACKS
Next greater element
Valid parentheses
Monotonic stack
Expression evaluation

7.QUEUES
Queue basics
Deque
Circular queue
Monotonic queue

8.TREES
DFS traversals: preorder, inorder, postorder
BFS traversal (level order)
Height and diameter
Balanced tree
Invert binary tree
Lowest common ancestor
Path sum problems
Binary search trees (BST)
Insert, delete, search in BST

9.HEAPS AND PRIORITY QUEUES
Min heap
Max heap
Heapify
K largest or smallest elements
Merge k sorted lists
Priority queue with custom comparator

10.GRAPHS
Graph representations
DFS
BFS
Connected components
Cycle detection
Bipartite graph
Topological sort
Shortest path algorithms (Dijkstra, Bellman Ford)
Minimum spanning tree (Kruskal, Prim)
Union Find (Disjoint Set)
Path compression and union by rank

11.DYNAMIC PROGRAMMING
DP on arrays
DP on subsequences
Longest increasing subsequence
Longest common subsequence
Edit distance
Knapsack problems
DP on grids
DP on trees
Bitmask DP

12.GREEDY ALGORITHMS
Activity selection
Interval scheduling
Merging intervals
Minimum platforms
Greedy vs DP comparison

13.TRIES
Insert and search
Prefix queries
Word dictionary
Autocomplete style problems

14.ADVANCED OPTIONAL
Segment tree
Fenwick tree
KMP algorithm
Z algorithm
Suffix array
LCA using binary lifting
Mo algorithm

15.MOST IMPORTANT FOR INTERVIEWS
Arrays
Strings
HashMap and HashSet
Sliding window
Two pointers
Linked list
Binary trees
DFS and BFS
Dynamic programming basics
Heaps
Basic graph algorithms

16.OPTIONAL BUT VERY USEFUL
Tries
Union Find
Topological sort
Greedy algorithms
Bitmask DP
